help.title: Help
help.about_description: A visual GUI tool for managing OpenCode and Oh My OpenCode configuration files
help.author: Author
help.priority_content:
1. Remote Configuration
   Configuration obtained through API or remote server
   Highest priority, overrides all local configurations

2. Global Configuration
   Location: ~/.config/opencode/opencode.json
   Default configuration affecting all projects

3. Custom Configuration
   Configuration file specified via --config parameter
   Used for specific scenario configuration overrides

4. Project Configuration
   Location: <project root>/opencode.json
   Project-level configuration, affects current project only

5. .opencode Directory Configuration
   Location: <project root>/.opencode/config.json
   Hidden configuration directory within project

6. Inline Configuration
   Configuration specified directly via command line parameters
   Lowest priority, but most flexible

Configuration Merge Rules:
- Higher priority configurations override lower priority ones with the same name
- Unspecified configuration items inherit values from lower priorities
- Provider and Model configurations are deeply merged
help.usage_content:
1. Provider Management
   Add custom API providers
   Configure API addresses and keys
   Support multiple SDKs: @ai-sdk/anthropic, @ai-sdk/openai, etc.

2. Model Management
   Add models under Provider
   Support quick selection of preset common models
   Configure model parameters (context limits, output limits, etc.)

3. Agent Management (Oh My OpenCode)
   Configure Agents for different purposes
   Bind configured Provider/Model
   Support preset Agent templates

4. Category Management (Oh My OpenCode)
   Configure task categories
   Set Temperature for different categories
   Bind corresponding models

5. Permission Management
   Configure tool usage permissions
   allow: Allow usage
   ask: Ask each time
   deny: Deny usage

6. External Import
   Detect configurations from Claude Code and other tools
   One-click import of existing configurations

Notes:
- Please click Save button after modifications
- Recommend regular backup of configuration files
- Agent/Category models must be configured Provider/Model
help.options_content:
According to OpenCode official documentation:

„ÄêOptions„ÄëDefault configuration parameters for models
- These configurations are used every time the model is called
- Suitable for common fixed configurations
- Example: thinking.type, thinking.budgetTokens

„ÄêVariants„ÄëSwitchable variant configurations
- Users can switch via variant_cycle shortcut
- Suitable for different scenario configuration combinations
- Example: high/medium/low different budgetTokens

‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê
Thinking Mode Configuration Examples
‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê

„ÄêClaude„Äë
  options:
    thinking:
      type: "enabled"
      budgetTokens: 16000
  variants:
    high:
      thinking:
        budgetTokens: 32000
    max:
      thinking:
        budgetTokens: 64000

„ÄêOpenAI„Äë
  options:
    reasoningEffort: "high"
  variants:
    medium:
      reasoningEffort: "medium"
    low:
      reasoningEffort: "low"

„ÄêGemini„Äë
  options:
    thinkingConfig:
      thinkingBudget: 8000
  variants:
    high:
      thinkingConfig:
        thinkingBudget: 16000
